title: China-Lesotho Friendship Fund donates a borehole to St. Boniface High School (Linked to #55784)
description: On 21 September 2017, the China-Lesotho People to People Friendship Action Fund officially donated a borehole and a check for 20,000 M (#55784) to St. Boniface High School in Leribe, Lesotho. The borehole will alleviate water shortage issues in the area. The cost of the borehole is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
China-Lesotho Friendship Fund donates a borehole to St. Boniface High School (Linked to #55784)

# Description
On 21 September 2017, the China-Lesotho People to People Friendship Action Fund officially donated a borehole and a check for 20,000 M (#55784) to St. Boniface High School in Leribe, Lesotho. The borehole will alleviate water shortage issues in the area. The cost of the borehole is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on water supply improvement for a school, with no direct energy or environmental implications
evidence: Borehole donation to address water shortage, educational institution focus

title: China-Lesotho Friendship Fund donates supplies to Berea high school students (Linked to #55795)
description: On 11 August 2017, the China-Lesotho People to People Friendship Action Fund donated 53,000 M (#55795) and school supply kits to low-income students from 21 different high schools in Berea, Lesotho. The value of this donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Government donates $10,000 worth of materials to Union of Liberian Artists
description: On August 13 of 2017, the Chinese Government donated $10,000 worth of Arts materials to the Union of Liberian Artists (ULA) during a Liberian Art showcase at the Chinese embassy. The donation is part of China's efforts in supporting the development of Liberian art.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title

# Description
On August 13 of 2017, the Chinese Government donated $10,000 worth of Arts materials to the Union of Liberian Artists (ULA) during a Liberian Art showcase at the Chinese embassy. The donation is part of China's efforts in supporting the development of Liberian art.
justification: Project involves donation of art materials for cultural development, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of $10,000 worth of arts materials to support Liberian art development

title: Chinese Government help to train the Liberian National Police
description: On September 23rd 2017, the fifth Chinese peacekeeping police team in Liberia held a ceremony to consolidate police training in Liberia on the 22nd, marking the successful completion of the 33-day practical skills training. The training started on August 2017.   On November 30th, 2017, China's Deputy Inspector General for International Cooperation at the Ministry of Public Security, Ll Ll announced that the Chinese government has committed to continuing assist with the training of the Liberian National Police (LNP) with an emphasis on Form Police Unit (FPU).
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government help to train the Liberian National Police

# Description
On September 23rd 2017, the fifth Chinese peacekeeping police team in Liberia held a ceremony to consolidate police training in Liberia on the 22nd, marking the successful completion of the 33-day practical skills training. The training started on August 2017.   On November 30th, 2017, China's Deputy Inspector General for International Cooperation at the Ministry of Public Security, Ll Ll announced that the Chinese government has committed to continuing assist with the training of the Liberian National Police (LNP) with an emphasis on Form Police Unit (FPU).
justification: Project focuses on police training and capacity building, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Training of Liberian National Police, focus on practical skills and Form Police Unit

title: Confucius Institute co-sponsors week long skills training course
description: The Confucius Institute with China-aid-Liberia Bamboo, Rattan Weaving and Vegetable Planting Program co-sponsored a week long skills training course at the end of July in 2017. Skills included Chinese language, production of bamboo, rattan weaving and vegetable planting and the training course took place in Monrovia.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Confucius Institute co-sponsors week long skills training course

# Description
The Confucius Institute with China-aid-Liberia Bamboo, Rattan Weaving and Vegetable Planting Program co-sponsored a week long skills training course at the end of July in 2017. Skills included Chinese language, production of bamboo, rattan weaving and vegetable planting and the training course took place in Monrovia.
justification: Project focuses on skills training and education without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Skills training course in language, bamboo/rattan weaving, and vegetable planting

title: Chinese Government Grants Scholarships in Liberia
description: In 2017, China provided 27 slots of Chinese Government Scholarship, 16 slots of one-year Master Scholarship and about 200 training opportunities for Liberian students, professionals and military officials.

EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government Grants Scholarships in Liberia

justification: Project focuses on education and training without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships and training opportunities for students and professionals

title: Chinese Embassy provides grant for Liberia-China Wushu School and Gymnasium in the SKD Complex
description: The Liberia National Wushu Association in collaboration with the Chinese Embassy in Monrovia helped to fund the Liberia-China Wushu School and Gymnasium at the back of the SKD sports complex. The project includes a school, gym, offices, bathroom, and many other facilities. Construction began in June 2017. The facility was handed over on January 6, 2018. (All Africa)  The program was organized by the LNWA in collaboration with the 4th UNMIL Chinese Police (FPU) and the Confucius Institute at the University of Liberia.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides grant for Liberia-China Wushu School and Gymnasium in the SKD Complex

# Description
The Liberia National Wushu Association in collaboration with the Chinese Embassy in Monrovia helped to fund the Liberia-China Wushu School and Gymnasium at the back of the SKD sports complex. The project includes a school, gym, offices, bathroom, and many other facilities. Construction began in June 2017. The facility was handed over on January 6, 2018. (All Africa)  The program was organized by the LNWA in collaboration with the 4th UNMIL Chinese Police (FPU) and the Confucius Institute at the University of Liberia.
justification: Project focuses on education and sports facilities without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of Wushu School and Gymnasium, educational and sports focus

title: China Eximbank provides $105.23 million preferential buyer’s credit for Ivato International Airport to Boulevard of Europe Expressway Project
description: On August 30, 2017, China Eximbank and the Government of Madagascar signed a preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement worth $105,230,500 million for the Ivato International Airport to Boulevard of Europe Expressway Project. Then, on January 10, 2018, the High Constitutional Court of Madagascar authorized the ratification of this PBC agreement. This PBC has a 20 year maturity. Its interest rate and grace period are unknown. This project involves the construction of an 18.67 km tolled expressway connecting the Ivato International Airport to the Boulevard De L'europe in Antananarivo, the capital of Madagascar. It is being implemented in two phases.  China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC) is the contractor responsible for implementation. In August 2015, CRBC signed a commercial contract to construct the road. Then, from November 8, 2015 to November 10, 2015, a delegation led by the Vice President of the China Eximbank paid a working visit to Madagascar where the group made a pre-loan inspection of the airport expressway. The road's connection line (Phase I of the project) was completed within six months and served the Summit of Francophone Countries (La Francophonie). Phase 1, which is also known as the Andohatapenaka Ring Road Project (or la Rocade d'Andohatapenaka), was 4.759 km in length, and its opening ceremony was held on November 18, 2016. Phase 2 is 13.911 km in length and it was scheduled for completion by the end of 2018.    On November 5, 2021, the final signing ceremony for the handover document of the Airport Expressway project was held, bringing the project to completion. In attendance at the ceremony were Jerry Hartrefendrazana, Madagascar Minister of Public Works, and Guo Xiaomei, Chinese Ambassador to Madagascar. The roadway starts at Chaha Sauca and ends at the Ivato International Airport, stretching a total of 10.93 kilometers. With the completion of this project, it is estimated that the time necessary to travel from downtown Antananarivo and the airport will be reduced from 2 hours to fifteen minutes.
staff_comments: 1. The French project title is voie rapide reliant l’Aéroport international d’Ivato et le Boulevard de l’Europe. The Chinese project title is 马达加斯加首都机场快速路项目 or 马达加斯加首都伊瓦图机场至欧洲大道快速路一期项目
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
China Eximbank provides $105.23 million preferential buyer’s credit for Ivato International Airport to Boulevard of Europe Expressway Project

# Description
On August 30, 2017, China Eximbank and the Government of Madagascar signed a preferential buyer’s credit (PBC) agreement worth $105,230,500 million for the Ivato International Airport to Boulevard of Europe Expressway Project. Then, on January 10, 2018, the High Constitutional Court of Madagascar authorized the ratification of this PBC agreement. This PBC has a 20 year maturity. Its interest rate and grace period are unknown. This project involves the construction of an 18.67 km tolled expressway connecting the Ivato International Airport to the Boulevard De L'europe in Antananarivo, the capital of Madagascar. It is being implemented in two phases.  China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC) is the contractor responsible for implementation. In August 2015, CRBC signed a commercial contract to construct the road. Then, from November 8, 2015 to November 10, 2015, a delegation led by the Vice President of the China Eximbank paid a working visit to Madagascar where the group made a pre-loan inspection of the airport expressway. The road's connection line (Phase I of the project) was completed within six months and served the Summit of Francophone Countries (La Francophonie). Phase 1, which is also known as the Andohatapenaka Ring Road Project (or la Rocade d'Andohatapenaka), was 4.759 km in length, and its opening ceremony was held on November 18, 2016. Phase 2 is 13.911 km in length and it was scheduled for completion by the end of 2018.    On November 5, 2021, the final signing ceremony for the handover document of the Airport Expressway project was held, bringing the project to completion. In attendance at the ceremony were Jerry Hartrefendrazana, Madagascar Minister of Public Works, and Guo Xiaomei, Chinese Ambassador to Madagascar. The roadway starts at Chaha Sauca and ends at the Ivato International Airport, stretching a total of 10.93 kilometers. With the completion of this project, it is estimated that the time necessary to travel from downtown Antananarivo and the airport will be reduced from 2 hours to fifteen minutes.
justification: Project is focused on transportation infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 18.67 km tolled expressway connecting airport to city center, general transportation infrastructure project

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 190 million grant for Egg Road Rehabilitation Project (Linked to Project ID#57648)
description: In March 2017, the Egg Road Rehabilitation Project was one of six projects discussed by Malagasy President Hery Rajaonarimampianina and Chinese President Xi Jinping. Then, on August 18, 2017, the International Economic Cooperation Agency of the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Madagascar signed a grant agreement for the project. The Chinese Government reportedly committed RMB 190 million of grant funding.   The Egg Road Rehabilitation Project involves the rehabilitation of a 19.25 kilometer road and connects three rural communes (Mahitsy, Ampanotokana and Mahazaza) located northwest of the capital city of Antananarivo. It consists of road construction of a main line and five connecting lines for and related safety facilities, bus stops, and harbor-style parking zones. The Egg Road (or Egg Route) is the only daily transport route for the 30,000 inhabitants of the three adjacent municipalities, 80% of whom depend on poultry farming production from 40 large local producers. The idea for ​this project was reportedly born when egg producers complained to the Malagasy President that most of their eggs break en route to their destination due to the poor condition of the road. Jiangxi Zhongmei Engineering Construction Co., Ltd. is the contractor responsible fo implementation. It pledged to recruit around 300 local employees to facilitate project implementation in April 2019.   According to the President of Madagascar’s twitter account and the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar, construction officially began on August 13, 2018. Then, in 2019, the Chinese Embassy reported that several sections of the road had been completed. However, the COVID-19 pandemic slowed the implementation of this project. Its expected completion date is September 2021. Upon completion, it is expected that the 7 km journey between Mahazaza and Mahitsy will only take 15 minutes, as compared to the current journey of 90 minutes. Upon completion, it is also expected that the "egg road” will allow for the transport of around 150,000 eggs per day.  This project is linked to China funding the feasibility study of the Egg Road (#57648).  In February 2021, the road was 60% complete. In January 2022, the road has been officially delivered to Madagascar for use.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is “鸡蛋路”项目 or 鸡蛋路项目. The French project title is Réhabilitation de la 'route des œufs” or Projet d'aide de route dans la banlieue de la capitale de Madagascar or Projet de route dans le district d’Ambohidratrimo.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 190 million grant for Egg Road Rehabilitation Project (Linked to Project ID#57648)

# Description
In March 2017, the Egg Road Rehabilitation Project was one of six projects discussed by Malagasy President Hery Rajaonarimampianina and Chinese President Xi Jinping. Then, on August 18, 2017, the International Economic Cooperation Agency of the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Madagascar signed a grant agreement for the project. The Chinese Government reportedly committed RMB 190 million of grant funding.   The Egg Road Rehabilitation Project involves the rehabilitation of a 19.25 kilometer road and connects three rural communes (Mahitsy, Ampanotokana and Mahazaza) located northwest of the capital city of Antananarivo. It consists of road construction of a main line and five connecting lines for and related safety facilities, bus stops, and harbor-style parking zones. The Egg Road (or Egg Route) is the only daily transport route for the 30,000 inhabitants of the three adjacent municipalities, 80% of whom depend on poultry farming production from 40 large local producers. The idea for ​this project was reportedly born when egg producers complained to the Malagasy President that most of their eggs break en route to their destination due to the poor condition of the road. Jiangxi Zhongmei Engineering Construction Co., Ltd. is the contractor responsible fo implementation. It pledged to recruit around 300 local employees to facilitate project implementation in April 2019.   According to the President of Madagascar’s twitter account and the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar, construction officially began on August 13, 2018. Then, in 2019, the Chinese Embassy reported that several sections of the road had been completed. However, the COVID-19 pandemic slowed the implementation of this project. Its expected completion date is September 2021. Upon completion, it is expected that the 7 km journey between Mahazaza and Mahitsy will only take 15 minutes, as compared to the current journey of 90 minutes. Upon completion, it is also expected that the "egg road” will allow for the transport of around 150,000 eggs per day.  This project is linked to China funding the feasibility study of the Egg Road (#57648).  In February 2021, the road was 60% complete. In January 2022, the road has been officially delivered to Madagascar for use.
justification: Road rehabilitation project primarily focused on improving transportation infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Rehabilitation of 19.25 km road, focus on improving transport efficiency and local economic activity

title: Chinese Government donates office supplies to the Malagasy National Assembly
